class.name: Word.TextFrame
class.description: Represents the text frame of a shape object.

properties.name: autoSizeSetting
properties.description: The automatic sizing settings for the text frame. A text frame can be set to automatically fit the text to the text frame, to automatically fit the text frame to the text, or not perform any automatic sizing.

examples.description: Configure a shape's text frame to automatically resize to fit its text content

properties.name: bottomMargin
properties.description: Represents the bottom margin, in points, of the text frame.

examples.description: Set the bottom margin of a shape's text frame to 20 points

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the text frame's request context to verify the connection between the add-in and Word before performing operations on a shape's text frame.

properties.name: hasText
properties.description: Specifies if the text frame contains text.

examples.description: Check if a shape's text frame contains text and display an alert with the result

properties.name: leftMargin
properties.description: Represents the left margin, in points, of the text frame.

examples.description: Set the left margin of a shape's text frame to 20 points

properties.name: noTextRotation
properties.description: Returns True if text in the text frame shouldn't rotate when the shape is rotated.

examples.description: Prevent text from rotating when a shape is rotated by setting the noTextRotation property to true

properties.name: orientation
properties.description: Represents the angle to which the text is oriented for the text frame. See Word.ShapeTextOrientation for details.

examples.description: Set the text orientation of a shape's text frame to vertical (rotated 90 degrees)

properties.name: rightMargin
properties.description: Represents the right margin, in points, of the text frame.

examples.description: Set the right margin of a shape's text frame to 20 points

properties.name: topMargin
properties.description: Represents the top margin, in points, of the text frame.

examples.description: Set the top margin of a shape's text frame to 20 points

properties.name: verticalAlignment
properties.description: Represents the vertical alignment of the text frame. See Word.ShapeTextVerticalAlignment for details.

examples.description: Set the vertical alignment of a shape's text frame to center

properties.name: wordWrap
properties.description: Determines whether lines break automatically to fit text inside the shape.

examples.description: Disable automatic line wrapping for a shape's text frame so that text extends beyond the shape boundaries instead of breaking into multiple lines

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

examples.description: Load and display the text frame properties of the first shape in the document, including its margins and text orientation.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

examples.description: Configure multiple text frame properties at once to set margins and text orientation for a shape's text frame

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it. Whereas the original Word.TextFrame object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.TextFrameData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Serialize a shape's text frame properties to JSON format for logging or data export purposes.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a shape's text frame object across multiple sync calls to safely modify its properties without getting "InvalidObjectPath" errors

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for contex

examples.description: Load a shape's text frame properties, use them, then release the memory by untracking the object to optimize performance
